description:
A new adaption of the manga of the same name by Togashi Yoshihiro.

A Hunter is one who travels the world doing all sorts of dangerous tasks. From capturing criminals to searching deep within uncharted lands for any lost treasures. Gon is a young boy whose father disappeared long ago, being a Hunter. He believes if he could also follow his father's path, he could one day reunite with him.

After becoming 12, Gon leaves his home and takes on the task of entering the Hunter exam, notorious for its low success rate and high probability of death to become an official Hunter. He befriends the revenge-driven Kurapika, the doctor-to-be Leorio and the rebellious ex-assassin Killua in the exam, with their friendship prevailing throughout the many trials and threats they come upon taking on the dangerous career of a Hunter.
synonyms: ฮันเตอร์ x ฮันเตอร์

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Chimera
tags.description: Features a beast made by combining animals, usually with humans.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Shogi
tags.description: Centers around the game of shogi.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Board Game
tags.description: Centers around characters playing board games.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Un4v5s8bgsVk9Xp)

A Japanese manga artist. He is most notable for having created [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/manga/30053/Yu-Yu-Hakusho/), for which he received the Shogakukan Manga Award in 1994, and [Hunter × Hunter](https://anilist.co/manga/30026/Hunter-x-Hunter/). In 1987, Togashi received the 34th Tezuka Award, the most influential new comic artist award in Japan, for his one-shot Buttobi Straight. 

Togashi is married to [Naoko Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/96946/), the creator of [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/manga/30092/Sailor-Moon/). His brother, [Hideaki Togashi](https://anilist.co/staff/174009/), is also a manga artist and has helped him work on his series on multiple occasions. 

Since 2006, Hunter x Hunter has gone on numerous lengthy hiatuses due to varying reasons, Including but not limited to: Togashi's struggle with Lumbago, exhaustion, and his mental health. His physical and mental health was also a leading cause in the premature conclusion of Yu Yu Hakusho.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/75655903) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/something_Yoshimatsu/)

Affiliated with Studio Live since 1982. Studied under [Toyoo Ashida](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/). He has deep ties into [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) ever since working as a character designer on [Trigun](https://anilist.co/anime/6/) in 1998. A member of the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA).

Works as a mangaka under the name Something Yoshimatsu (サムシング吉松).

Galneryus was formed in early 2001 by guitarist Syu (formerly from Valkyr, Animetal, Aushvitz, and Masaki Project) along with vocalist Yama-B, frontman of AxBites, Rekion, River End and solo artist of Gunbridge. Both veterans of the Japanese metal scene they formed Galneryus with the intention to "express both of their musical tastes/ideas" and so they started looking for additional members to complete the band. They recruited A on keyboards (who had previously played with Syu in Valkyr), Shôgo Himuro on bass, and Toshihiro "Tossan" Yui (formerly of Cemetery, Honey Quest) on drums.

In October 2001, the band released a 2-track demo titled "United Flag". The demo was self-produced and released independently. This EP started gaining the attention of both fans and independent record labels as well.

After playing with other metal bands like Fairy Mirror, Mephistopheles, Galactica Phantom, Mastermind, and Concerto Moon, Galneryus went back to the studio to record a second EP. Rebel Flag was released through the independent label Iron Shock in August 2002. The EP again used support musicians to fill the band slots, with Shôgo Himuro again on bass, Toshihiro Yui again on drums, and Yoshinori Kataoka on keyboards (replacing A).

In 2003, they were invited to play the Melodic Metal Festival in Japan which featured Swedish power metal band Dragonland, as well as Australia's Dungeon. As a result, Dragonland invited Galneryus to play with them the next time they toured Japan.

Galneryus was also invited to perform on two metal compilation cover albums with other bands such as Masaki Project, Saber Tiger, and Mephistopheles. Galneryus performed the song "Black Diamond" (originally from Finnish power metal band Stratovarius) on the compilation album Stand Proud! III and performed the song "Soldier of Fortune" (from Japanese heavy metal band Loudness) on the compilation album Japanese Heavy Metal Tribute Tamashii II. For these songs, the band used supporting musicians Toshihiro Yui on drums, Yusuke on bass, and Yuhki on keyboards. Both compilation albums were released simultaneously in December 2002 on the same day through Iron Shock and distributed through the record label VAP.

VAP itself signed Galneryus and the band set to work on writing and recording their full-length album The Flag of Punishment which featured all 5 EP songs re-written and re-recorded and also cover art by famed Final Fantasy artist Yoshitaka Amano. At this time Galneryus ceased using temporary members and recruited permanently Tsui on bass, Yuhki ..boards (formerly of Ark Storm and Marge Litch), and Junichi Satoh on drums. The album was finally released in October 2003.

In March 2005 Galneryus released their second album Advance to the Fall. They released their third full-length album (Beyond the End of Despair...) in July 2006.  After the Live for Rebirth tour, Tsui left Galneryus and Yu-To (Deluhi) was recruited to fill in for bass. The band shortly after released One for All - All for One in 2007.  Recently, Galneryus has debuted on iTunes Music Store making their material widely available in the United States.  

On October 10, 2008, it was announced that vocalist Yama-B and bassist Yu-To were leaving the band at the end of the Back To The Flag tour. The decision was made while in the process or recording/releasing of their fifth full album, Reincarnation. According to Yama-B's note left to the fans on Galneryus' official site, he left due to the band's growth and change. In the note Yama-B stated that due to the differences in the style of their music, he was leaving. He and the rest of Galneryus and Mr. Hisatake are all OK with this and wish each other well as they go their separate ways.

Since the band formed, Galneryus adopted a dress style that bordered between Visual Kei and Sci-Fi. However, recently they have adopted a more modern dress with the release of their third full-length album. Galneryus also writes all of their lyrics in English. However, in more recent songs, in particular, Serenade, Everlasting and The Night Craver, there are Japanese lyrics. Syu mentioned in a recent interview that the band would be incorporating some Japanese lyrics into their new album One for All - All for One. 

Their songs "Alsatia" and "Cause Disarray" are featured on the anime Mnemosyne as the opening and end theme, respectively.  Current Line-up  * Syu - Lead/Rhythm Guitars/Backing Vocals * Masatoshi "Sho" Ono - Vocals * Taka - Bass * Yuhki - Keyboards/Backing Vocals * Junichi Satoh - Drums

Source: http://www.vap.co.jp/galneryus/  http://www.myspace.com/galneryusworld

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/midorihatoneko) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/i/user/286739197)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [older animator](https://anilist.co/staff/250761/) by the same name._

[Website](http://www.yoshihisahirano.com/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/Hirano_comp)

Studied composing at Juilliard School in 1992, and later at Eastman School of Music. Some of the awards he has received include first prize in the Axia Tape Competition in Japan during his high school years and New York's New Music for Young Ensembles. He has composed music for concert, dance, film and radio with compositions ranging from classical to pop and contemporary music. In recent years he has composed a number of anime soundtracks. He has also made music for Tokyo DisneySea's 2002 and 2004 countdown celebrations.    

Hirano has paired with pianist Masako Hosoda to form the unit Bleu and released two albums. He is also responsible for some of the orchestration and arrangement for a number of Ali Project's albums.
Affiliated with [Nippon TV](https://anilist.co/studio/6939/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nabe_atsu_live)

name.first: Fear, and Loathing in Las Vegas
name.native: フィアー·アンド·ロージング·イン·ラスベガス

node.description:
[Website](http://www.lasvegas-jp.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Falilv) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/Falilv_Official/)

__Biography__
The band formed in 2008 in Kobe, Japan. Fear, and Loathing in Las Vegas combines electronica and metalcore, further exploring a number of influences from other genres among their discography. The singing is comprised of twin vocals; the destructive shouts of one vocalist contrasts with the autotune of the other, which gives them a presence like no other. In November 2009, their first EP "Burn the Disco Floor with Your 2-step!!" was released.

__Members__
- So - vocal, scream vocal, programming (joined in 2009)
- Minami - vocal, scream vocal, keyboard, programming
- Taiki - guitar, chorus, vocal
- Tomonori - drums
- Tetsuya - bass, chorus, vocal (joined in 2019)

__Former Members__
- Mashu - bass (left on September 21, 2013)
- Sxun - guitar, chorus, vocal (left on June 30, 2018)
- Kei - bass, chorus, vocal (died on January 12, 2019)

Yuzu (ゆず) is a Japanese popular music duo. Its members are Kitagawa Yujin (北川悠仁) and Iwasawa Kouji (岩沢厚治). Both of the band members come from Yokohama in Kanagawa Prefecture.  They were discovered as popular street musicians. At first, their band name was “Lights”, but Kitagawa thought that name was too hick, so they changed the name “Yuzu”. At that time, Kitagawa was eating a Yuzu sherbet, so he named their band after it. (Incidentally, Iwasawa ate vanilla ice cream. Perhaps the band name might have been Vanilla. Sometimes Iwasawa tells this story.) The fans of Yuzu are called “Yuzukko”.  In Jan 9 2013, They released their 37th single "REASON", The 1st track “REASON” Used as the 3rd ending theme song for “Hunter x Hunter 2011” anime. And as the theme song for the film “Hunter x Hunter: Phantom Rouge”
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bokuen)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hl_y3)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/344493581)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/niuya) | [Weibo](https://www.weibo.com/niuya123)

Liang moved to Japan in 2007 in order to further her art studies, taking up professional drawing classes and graduating in 2011. She joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) right afterwards, becoming a key animator after one year of working for the company.

She has named [Toshiyuki Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/103724/) as one of her main influences.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2189672342) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/abiru1980/)

Affiliated with [Studio Kafka](https://anilist.co/studio/6754/Studio-Kafka).

[Official Website](https://www.birte-baumgardt.de/) | [Synchronkartei](https://www.synchronkartei.de/sprecher/3385/2) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bbsynx) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/synxtress/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/p1b9f44vegyae8n)

Affiliated with [Dangun Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6521/). Initially worked as a production assistant.

His work on the 34th episode of [Hunter x Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/11061/) attracted a lot of attention within the industry, as well as his more recent work in [Sword Art Online: Alicization](https://anilist.co/anime/100182/), in which he mostly teamed-up with [Kentarou Waki](https://anilist.co/staff/146156/).
